intro: Gagea confusa, commonly known as the confused gagea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its small, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest understories. It produces a bulbous stem that stores nutrients, allowing it to survive in harsh conditions. Gagea confusa is often found in association with other early spring bloomers, contributing to the diversity of flora in its habitat.
